abstract: Amid all the maneuvering over the fate of Yahoo, Time Warner is again exploring whether it can persuade either Microsoft or Yahoo to buy its AOL unit.
snippet: Amid all the maneuvering over the fate of Yahoo, Time Warner is again exploring whether it can persuade either Microsoft or Yahoo to buy its AOL unit.
lead_paragraph: Amid all the maneuvering over the fate of Yahoo, Time Warner is again exploring whether it can persuade either Microsoft or Yahoo to buy its AOL unit.

headline.main: Little Interest in Buying AOL as the Unit Is Shopped Again
headline.print_headline: Little Interest in Buying AOL As the Unit Is Shopped Again

byline.original: By Saul Hansell and Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The Japanese video game titans announced wide-ranging new games and services at the E3 convention on Tuesday but did not alter their overall strategies in the fast-growing game market.
snippet: The Japanese video game titans announced wide-ranging new games and services at the E3 convention on Tuesday but did not alter their overall strategies in the fast-growing game market.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  The Japanese video game titans Nintendo and Sony announced wide-ranging, if not entirely breathtaking, new games and services at the E3 convention here on Tuesday but did not alter their overall strategies in the fast-growing game market, as Microsoft did on Monday.

abstract: As VMware, Microsoft and others make deals to gain server and desktop virtualization technology, The 451 Group looks at possible acquistions that could enable these or other buyers to prevail in another looming virtualization battleground: the smartphone.
lead_paragraph: As VMware, Microsoft and others make deals to gain server and desktop virtualization technology, The 451 Group looks at possible acquistions that could enable these or other buyers to prevail in another looming virtualization battleground: the smartphone.

abstract: Amid all the maneuvering over the fate of Yahoo, Time Warner is again exploring whether it can persuade either Microsoft or Yahoo to buy its AOL unit.
lead_paragraph: Amid all the maneuvering over the fate of Yahoo, Time Warner is again exploring whether it can persuade either Microsoft or Yahoo to buy its AOL unit.

headline.main: Listening, But Little Interest, as AOL Is Shopped Again

abstract: Yahoo is pulling out the stops — and leaning heavily on the bold and underline buttons — in its effort to portray Carl Icahn and Microsoft as an inept tag team intent on short-changing them by selling the company (or its crown jewels) for less than a fair price.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo is pulling out the stops — and leaning heavily on the bold and underline buttons — in its effort to portray Carl Icahn and Microsoft as an inept tag team intent on short-changing them by selling the company (or its crown jewels) for less than a fair price.

headline.main: Beware of ‘Odd Couple,’ Yahoo Tells Shareholders

abstract: Yahoo warned shareholders Thursday not to trust the “odd couple” of Microsoft and Carl C. Icahn. The three entities are embroiled in a proxy fight for control of Yahoo’s board.
snippet: Yahoo warned shareholders Thursday not to trust the “odd couple” of Microsoft and Carl C. Icahn. The three entities are embroiled in a proxy fight for control of Yahoo’s board.
lead_paragraph: In the  latest salvo in the proxy fight for control of Yahoo, the company is urging shareholders to beware of the “odd couple” — Microsoft and the corporate raider Carl C. Icahn — who are locked in a “marriage of convenience” but have no clear plan for what they would do if they took control of the board.

headline.main: The New ‘Odd Couple': Microsoft and Icahn
